Format - style

A style definition consists of:

  • a floating point value for the horizontal alignment.
  • a floating point value for the vertical alignment.
  • a floating point value for the font width.
  • a floating point value for the font height.
  • a floating point value for the left margin.
  • a floating point value for the top margin.
  • a floating point value for the right margin.
  • a floating point value for the bottom margin.
  • a color, being the text color.
  • a color, being the background color.
  • a color, being the draw color.
  • 8 bits being the metric for the font width and height.
  • 8 bits being the metric for the margin sizes.
  • 1 bit for the bold flag.
  • 1 bit for the italics flag.
  • 1 bit for the underline flag.
  • 1 bit for the strike flag.

Next, we have a warp.

Kate bitstream 0.2 makes use of this warp to add:

  • 1 bit for the justify flag.
  • a variable length integer, followed by this number of bytes being a name of a font to use for text using this style.

Kate bitstream 0.6 makes further use of this warp to add:

  • a metadata set.

Next, the data ends.
